New Records: Merih Demiral scored the fastest goal in the knockout stage of a European Championship, clocking in at 57 seconds.
This was the fourth fastest goal in Euro 2024 history.
Mert Gunok made an astonishing reflex save from Christoph Baumgartner's header, one of the best saves of the tournament.
Key Match Events: Turkey took the lead within a minute from Arda Guler's corner, converting into a goal by Merih Demiral.
Austria equalized just 57 seconds after falling behind, marking one of the fastest equalizers in tournament history.
Austria's Marcel Sabitzer was hit by a coin thrown from the stands, leading to a disturbance and prompting Salih Ozcan to plead with fans for calm.
The match was interrupted by fans throwing objects, including plastic cups and coins, creating a chaotic atmosphere.
Pre-Game Insights: Austria was known for their fast starts and high-pressing style, as seen in their previous matches.
Turkey countered with a tactical approach, bypassing Austria's press through longer balls and intelligent passing.
Post-Match Reflections: Ralf Rangnick, Austria's manager, reflected on the intense and entertaining match, acknowledging the team's performance.
Mert Gunok, Turkey's goalkeeper, expressed confidence in the team's progress and morale after the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Arda Guler, hailed as 'Turkish Messi,' was a constant threat with his technical ability and set-piece delivery.
The match was one of the most frenetic and thrilling games of the tournament, with high energy and chaotic moments.
Turkey's victory marked their progression to the quarter-finals, showcasing their passion and tactical versatility.
